That's great to hear that you're making the switch to more sustainable products! There are several eco-friendly sunscreen brands that share similar values and offer sustainable packaging options. Here are some recommendations:

1. **Badger**: Badger is a certified B Corp that offers a range of organic and natural sunscreens in recyclable aluminum tubes and glass jars. They also have a "Tin Take-Back" program, which encourages customers to return their empty containers for recycling.
2. **Blue Lizard**: Blue Lizard uses mineral-based sunscreens in recyclable tubes made from 50% post-consumer recycled materials. They also partner with TerraCycle to recycle their packaging and offer a discount for customers who return their empty tubes.
3. **Goddess Garden**: Goddess Garden offers organic and natural sunscreens in recyclable tubes and bottles. They also have a "Recycle & Reuse" program, which allows customers to return their empty containers for recycling and receive a discount on their next purchase.
4. **Stream2Sea**: Stream2Sea is a reef-safe and eco-friendly sunscreen brand that uses recyclable packaging made from 90% post-consumer recycled materials. They also partner with beach cleanups and conservation efforts to reduce ocean pollution.
5. **All Good**: All Good offers a range of natural and organic sunscreens in recyclable tubes and bottles. They also have a "Recycling Program" that encourages customers to return their empty containers for recycling and reuse.
6. **Raw Elements**: Raw Elements uses natural and organic ingredients in their sunscreens, which come in recyclable tubes and jars. They also partner with organizations to support beach cleanups and conservation efforts.
7. ** Kokua Sun Care**: Kokua Sun Care offers reef-safe and eco-friendly sunscreens in recyclable tubes made from 50% post-consumer recycled materials. They also partner with beach cleanups and conservation efforts to reduce ocean pollution.

When shopping for eco-friendly sunscreens, be sure to check the ingredient labels for natural and organic ingredients, as well as the packaging materials and recycling options. Additionally, look for certifications like the Leaping Bunny Program, which ensures that the products are free from animal testing and by-products.

Remember to always choose sunscreens that meet your skin type and needs, and apply them responsibly to minimize their impact on the environment.
